page.title: 14BALCH'S FARM
page.content: THE FARMS IN THIS AREA ARE MAINLY SMALL, AND BALCH'S FARM IS TYPICAL.THE TWO FIELDS OF ABOUT 6 ACRES IN TOTAL,ARE RENTED FROM THE LOCAL COUNCIL AND A HORSE,FOAL AND GOAT ARE KEPT ON THEM.OUR FRIEND'S DAD GOES OUT TO WORK TURVING WHILE THE MUM LOOKS AFTER THE CHILDREN AND ANIMALS.THE ANIMALS ARE 2 HORSES,A GOAT,SEVERAL CHICKENS,A COCK,A BANTAM,3 DOGS,A CAT,GOLD FISH AND 3 FINCHES.THE TROUBLES THEY HAVE ARE FROM THE GYPSY HORSES WHICH EAT THE GRASS AND MATE THE MARE,SO NOW SHE IS IN FOAL AND CAN'T BE RIDDEN FOR 6 MONTHS.THE CROWS EAT THE CHICKS AND THE WEASELS AND FOXES WILL TRY TO EAT THE HENS.THE MOLES MAKE AN AWFUL MESS OF THE FIELDS AND HAVE TO BE KEPT DOWN. THE LAND GETS VERY WET IN THE WINTER BECAUSE IT IS LOW AND NEAR THE RIVER.THE DRAINS ROUND HERE ARE CALLED REENS.
